alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Kent; Queen Anne's; Talbot (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 17 at 7:38PM EDT until April 18 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR EASTERN MARYLAND INCLUDING KENT, QUEEN ANNES, TALBOT, AND CAROLINE COUNTIES... * AFFECTED AREA...Kent MD, Queen Annes, Talbot and Caroline Counties. * TIMING...Noon to 8 PM Tuesday. * WINDS...West 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 25 to 30 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Low 60s. * IMPACTS...The combination of dry conditions, low humidity, and strong gusty winds may result in favorable conditions for the rapid spread of fires Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur due to a combination of strong winds, low relative humidities, and dry fuels. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings. For more information about wildfire danger, burn restrictions, and wildfire prevention and education, please visit your state forestry or environmental protection website.
